page.title: 14FARMING IN HATFIELD
page.content: The farm consists of 32 acres of land.Mr.Miller has owned it for twenty years.The previous owner used the land for training greyhounds,before that it was marshland.The land is now drained by dykes and maintained by the drainage board.At present the land is used for grazing and growing hay but they have had pigs,beef cattle and chickens.When Millers bought the farm there were no buildings now they have a house,workshops,Dutch barn,livery, stables and pigeon lofts.One store is rented for storing waste paper.The 18 stables are also rented.Machinery on the farm is old,consisting of a tractor,dumper,sawbench and the hiring of machinery to harvest the hay. Renowned for breeding excellent pigeons,buyers come from Australia, Japan,South Africa,Belgium,America and Egypt to visit Green Acre Farm.
